messageBody:
>So said Paul Zabelin on 2003-05-28 --------------------
>For our group consideration, I created one example of
>ExceptionTestCase usage to test some exceptions of Vector class:
>
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/src/VectorExceptionTest.java
>
>This is the way I have been using ExceptionTestCase in past projects
>and I am interested to learn if it is valid in your opinion.
>
>Do you think this example will be useful to include with junit
>samples?

Perhaps, but this technique makes it difficult to see which code blocks should throw which exceptions. I have to bounce back and forth between the test and the suite() method to determine which exceptions I should expect the code to throw. That's distracting.

The assertThrows pattern makes that clearer, even if it results in more code.
